feed.title: NewsTracker: boko haram
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Up to 150 drown, shot fleeing Boko Haram ambush in Nigeria: villagers
entry.summary: Up to 150 people have drowned in a river or been shot dead fleeing Boko Haram gunmen who raided a remote village in Nigeria's north-eastern Yobe state, locals say.

entry.title: Boko Haram Boss Denies He's Been Replaced
Boko Haram leader Shekau says he is alive
Cameroon pledges 2,450 troops to anti-Boko Haram force
Cameroon pledges 2,450 troops to anti-Boko Haram force
entry.summary: At a meeting in Cameroon in February, Nigeria and a group of neighboring countries that also includes Chad, Niger and Benin agreed to deploy around 8,700 troops against Boko Haram, which became an affiliate of the Islamic State group earlier this year.

entry.title: Boko Haram fight: Nigeria's army says 178 captives rescued
entry.summary: Boko Haram was pushed out of most of the vast swathes of territory it controlled at the start of the year but they have dispersed and returned to their guerilla tactics of hitting soft targets with bombs, and raiding towns.

entry.title: Nigeria: Army rescued 178 people from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Hundreds have been freed from Boko Haram captivity this year but none of the 219 girls abducted in April 2014 from a school in Chibok were among those rescued.

Some of those rescued last week said they had been held by Boko Haram for up to one year in villages just 25 miles from Maiduguri.

entry.title: Nigeria's army says it has rescued 178 people held captive by Boko Haram
entry.summary:
He added that a Boko Haram commander had also been captured and several militant camps were cleared around the town of Bama, about 70 km south-east of the state capital Maiduguri.

Nigeria's airforce also said that it helped ground troops repel an attack by Boko Haram around the village of Bitta on the southern edge of the Sambisa forest reserve, a stronghold of the militant group.

entry.title: Nigeria rescues 178 captives from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Boko Haram has been waging a six-year insurgency in the northeast of Africa's biggest economy in an attempt to establish an Islamist state adhering to strict sharia law.

entry.title: Nigeria's Army Says Rescued 178 Captives of Boko Haram
entry.summary: ABUJA - Nigeria's army said late on Sunday that it rescued 178 people held by Islamist militant group Boko Haram in Nigeria's Borno state, the heartland of the insurgency.

entry.title: Nigerian army: Troops rescue 178 captives, most children, destroy 8 Boko Haram camps
entry.summary: Nigerian troops rescued 178 people from Boko Haram in attacks that destroyed several camps of the Islamic extremists in the northeast of the country, an army statement said Sunday, Aug. 2.

entry.title: Nigeria: Review of soldiers condemned in Boko Haram war
entry.summary: The review comes three months after the inauguration of President Muhammadu Buhari, who has vowed to crush the Boko Haram Islamic uprising which has spilled across Nigeria's borders.

entry.title: Nigeria appoints new leader in fight against Boko Haram
entry.summary: LAGOS, Nigeria -- Nigeria's Defense Ministry has appointed a new general to head the multinational army to fight Boko Haram.

entry.title: New Nigerian general to head multinational Boko Haram fight
entry.summary: Chad announced Thursday that its troops killed 13 Boko Haram fighters in attacks this week near Lake Chad, where militants slit the throats of three villagers.

entry.title: Nigeria rescues 71, mostly women and girls, from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Women and children rescued by Nigerian soldiers from Boko Haram extremists in the northeast of Nigeria arrive at the military office in Maiduguri, Nigeria, Thursday, July 30, 2015.

Soldiers rescued 71 people, almost all girls and women, in firefights that killed many Boko Haram militants in villages near the northeastern city of Maiduguri, Nigeria's military said Thursday.

entry.title: Nigerian leader visits Cameroon as Boko Haram attacks
entry.summary:
"The two countries are intertwined and have no choice but to have a relationship to deal with Boko Haram," said Chris Fomunyoh, an analyst with the Washington-based National Democratic Institute.

On Monday, Boko Haram killed at least 29 people in two Christian villages in northeast Nigeria, while in Cameroon, suicide bombings claimed 60 lives over the past week.

entry.title: Nigerian leader visits Cameroon as Boko Haram attacks
entry.summary: More recently, Nigeria accused Cameroon of doing little to prevent Boko Haram from using their territory as a refuge.

entry.title: Boko Haram blamed for suicide bombing that killed at least 10 in Cameroon
entry.summary:
The attack on a popular night spot evening in the town of Maroua comes just days after other violence blamed on Boko Haram militants left at least 20 dead.

While there was no immediate claim of responsibility, Islamic militants from the Boko Haram group have been blamed for scores of attacks in the region this year.

Boko Haram, which was founded in neighbouring Nigeria, has vowed to attack Cameroon because the country has supported the Nigerian military's mission to defeat the group.

entry.title: US aiding and abetting Boko Haram by refusing Nigeria arms, says Buhari
Bombs kill 29 as Nigerian leader says US hampering fight
entry.summary: Buhari told policy makers at the U.S. Institute for Peace on Wednesday that Nigeria's armed forces are "largely impotent" because they do not possess the appropriate weapons to fight Boko Haram.

entry.title: AP Interview: Nigerian leader says multination forces soon ready to fight Boko Haram
entry.summary: He said his government is open to freeing detained militants in exchange for the girls' freedom, but only if it finds credible Boko Haram leaders to negotiate with.

entry.title: Nigerian leader: Forces ready soon to take on Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Buhari says a multinational African force will be in place within 10 days to take the fight to the Islamic extremist group Boko Haram that has killed thousands and was behind the abduction of hundreds of schoolgirls.

Buhari predicted in an interview with The Associated Press that Boko Haram would be defeated in 18 months or less.

Boko Haram in March declared an affiliation with the Islamic State group, and Buhari said it has links with Islamist militants in northern Mali.

entry.title: Nigerian leader: Forces ready soon to take on Boko Haram
entry.summary: But he predicted that the multinational force could break the back of Boko Haram within 18 months.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram fighters kill 23 in attack on north Cameroon village, residents say
entry.summary: Nigeria-based Boko Haram, which this year became the West African franchise of the Islamic State group, has targeted northern Cameroon repeatedly in retaliation for the country's participation in a regional military effort against the extremists.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram fighters kill 23 in attack on north Cameroon village, residents say
entry.summary: YAOUNDE, Cameroon - Residents of a village in the northern tip of Cameroon say suspected Boko Haram militants killed more than 20 people including multiple children in an attack Sunday night.

entry.title: Obama Endorses Nigerian Leader's Agenda For Defeating Boko Haram
Nigeria's new president visits Obama at White House to discuss Boko Haram
